instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no damage pulsing
threads.message:
No visible liquid or corrosion anywhere. Reported by the user that was working slowly and then just died

All rails pulsing.
In SMC bypass will repeatedly spin the fan for a split second every 2 seconds. Might stop after a few minutes.

No short found on any coils or big caps.

Does the CPU die on these out of nowhere?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no damage pulsing
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no damage pulsing
threads.message: VCORE is pulsing and <SIGNAL>PLT_REST_L</SIGNAL> doesn't seem to show at all. I don't have a scope to check.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no damage pulsing
threads.message:
DC voltmeter should be good enough.
Will not catch peak pulse, but you should note 1-2V pulse.

Check for pulse at <SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no damage pulsing
threads.message:
both pulsing
i don't get any pulse on <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no damage pulsing
threads.message:
Looks like PCH issue.
Heat it, may have accumulated crap underneath, or internal problem.
<SIGNAL>1V05_SUS</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no damage pulsing
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>1V05_SUS</SIGNAL> is consistently present, not pulsing.
I can try heating but it's unlikely that's crap underneath. Thanks for the help i wanted to confirm i am not going crazy today
